comment: She's a really tough grader but this is a difficult major. If you're not organized and aren't willing to put a lot of effort into your work, take someone else. She holds you to a high standard bc she believes in pushing you past your potential. She's v understanding and doesn't grade based off your peers. Most people passed due to her grace. Tbh

not good at giving advice
wastes alot of class time trying to explain things rather than have a set schedule planned
does not provide good feedback during class time

very model focused so if you are better at making models than drawing TAKE THIS CLASS
easy grader
decently forgiving

To prepare do your own research on subject before it is taught

Professor Hashas doesn't give clear instructions on what to do for each assignment because she doesn't explain them enough. Then she critiques our work for an hour and points out either what we can correct or what we did wrong. She then tells us about time management all the time but never GIVES us enough time in-between each assignment.

She constantly talks about time management when she doesn't understand that many students have other classes, a job, and many other household things they need to do. It gets annoying when you have more that 2 classes including the studio and you don't have all the time in the world.

There's no textbook, she just submits ungodly long pdf's to D2L and some vague class notes, lectures aren't recorded, three quizzes made up 30% of our grade and she gives only 15 minutes per quiz, with about 4 or more open ended/ essay questions on each. When she asks what students need help on she ignores it and says "this is college."
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: It's obvious that Professor Hashas doesn't enjoy any part of her job. She is consistently late to class and looks miserable throughout the entire class. She thinks it's okay to handle and even dismantle student's work which they would have worked on tirelessly the night before. As of now (6 weeks into the semester) she has not given a single grade.

Hashas was super unorganized and made it hard to keep track and remember the work. She gave very vague, hard to understand instructions then graded those assignments really harshly. I failed an essay (got a 42) then redid it with HER HELP and she gave me a 44. Definitely don't take her for ARCH 1001, but I recommend for Studios.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Professor Hashas has a very specific mindset of what she wants you to do and if it doesn't fit the version she has in her head it's worthless. use specific wording from the reading material is difficult because there are so many ways to describe the same thing that the use of a few words she wants to see is unreasonable. Very unreasonable grader.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She is very unorganized. She shows up to class and doesn't get anything done. We spent two weeks going over one topic and were behind. She gave us pop quizzes and then blamed us for not knowing the material. She expects you to read long passages and watch youtube videos but she doesn't go over it until a week later.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Behavior is somewhat erratic. If you take her for studio or thesis, your work needs to align with her research and she's very territorial on what she considers her turf. If you are able to first figure out, and then, second play by her rules, she has something to offer. She is knowledgable, but does miss class often, runs late. and leaves early.

Hashas was a really hard professor. She has incredibly high expectations but because of her, I pulled out my potential. Very caring if you ask questions, show good work and put in effort. If you're lazy, you'll fail.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: As a professor she is very rude. She also breaks your models and draw on you finish drafts. She will come to class late and make you stay after because all of the material is not covered. Also, she will grade your work and not tell you your grade until the complete end of the semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved this course and the subjects discussed in class. It also inspired me to reflect that into my studio projects. She made urban design and planning theory course very simple, easy, and straight forward without a lot of work. It was only 3 quizzes, midterm project, a catalog and final test. Highly recommended !

Prof. Hashas is a woman suitable for teaching those who enjoy being forced around like worker drone bees with a low autonomy to aspire their own ideas. She's a stubborn woman who wishes to have order in the learning process with no room for spontaneity in design concepts. Get ready for her self-aggrandizing lectures of why she is "golden" for arc.
Lacks a sense of empathy for the human condition. Stay away.
Professor Hashas is a wonderful professor who knows what she is doing and knows what she wants from her students. only take this professor if you are ambitious and not scared of critisism

She drew all over my drawings before I was able to even make a copy. Her instructions are unclear and she made me start over several times on every single assignment and wasn't clear on her critiques.

I know why everyone is bashing her. its coz she is very hard. Not clear, and never satisfied with your work. But guess what that's what you will be facing for 5 more years. She will make you do all nighter and criticize your hard work for no good reason, but if you cant handle that, than it might be a good indication that you wont make it anyway.

ok this teacher in not by any means easy but if your going into architecture trying to find easy teachers to slack off well u may not want to take this course. she can be tough but it only pushes you to find your best work. i had here first year and it was a fun class. this teacher will prepare you for all nighters and the next four years

Urban planning. Don't learn anything about this subject before you take the class b/c will not accept material from addition web sources and books. You only need. She is a Turk and still know little of the cities in Europe and refuses sources cites from University of Bath the #2 school of architecture in the UK and from Bauhause sp? Germany

She didn't like our class. She didn't like anything we did and we had some great work. we asked for aid and got nothing. I wish the school would fire her. I got instructions from other teachers b/c she would just leave right after class and wouldn't help during studio. Plus wtf was her office idk she wouldn't say AVOID!!!

Never again! I would never take another class she is teaching She grades hard even when she tells you that you are doing good work. She will ask you to do something and if you listen she will grade you down and claim she never said that (but i write things down so i know she said it) and her friends from tech holy crap are they dumb dumber than her

I can't believe I took this professor b/c she is the worse. I don't even think she knows what she is doing 99% of the time. She says things like no you are not supposed to know that yet. Which means you can't use what you know. Forget getting any help from here if you need to know how to use pastels, charcoal, pencils b/c she will not help you.

The worst professor I have ever had. She is never prepared to lecture she can not do the work she demands of you therefor she can not give you help. She will not answer questions, she does not know much about the subject she is teaching, basically you pay to teach yourself. She wastes the entire studio time and you are left working all night long.

She is really tough and very critical, but that is because she wants you to do your best!  She is very helpful when you ask questions, but make sure you write down what she says cuz she changes things a lot.

she's difficult in the beginning, middle, and end. she speaks horrible english and looks at you like you're crazy for not understanding. chances of getting an A are slim to none. i BARELY got a B. Do yourself a favor...RUUUUUUN!!! your GPA will thank you!!

Mine' is a good teacher. she tries her best to explain everything. her course is hard, she grades hard, if u slack u will not get a good grade. she tries to work with you so you can improve your grade. dont waste her time by sleeping in class or not paying attention, she hates that. at first she is kinda cold but she warms up eventually-take her

Absolutely the one of the best teachers the program has to offer. YES!!! she does grade tough and YES!! it is hard to understand her...AT FIRST!!..You just have to keep asking questions; by the 2nd project you will probably understand everything. If you're a slacker then get another teacher. If you want to work and make it to 3rd year take her

She may seem real tough at first but she is a really REALLY good teacher.  She really is good at helping you find your own style and technique to do things.  She's a bit of a tough grader but if you want a good portfolio, shes the one to take.
